titlestmt.titleproper: University of Connecticut, Thomas J. Dodd Research Center Records 1998.0290
Thomas J. Dodd Research Center Records (UConn)
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Betsy Pittman.

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2012-07-31T12:07-0400

did.unittitle: University of Connecticut, Thomas J. Dodd Research Center Records

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Archives & Special Collections, located at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, was created by the merger of Special Collections and Historical Manuscripts and Archives in 1995. The new area moved into the Dodd Center upon its opening. President William Clinton officiated at the dedication of the Center and kicked off the "Dodd Year", a year long series of lectures, exhibitions and events. Although the Center houses several entities, the vast majority of the information in the collection pertains to Archives & Special Collections.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, a division of the University of Connecticut Libraries, was created by the merger of Special Collections and Historical Manuscripts and Archives in 1995. The new area moved into the Dodd Research Center upon its opening. President William Clinton officiated at the dedication of the Center and kicked off the "Dodd Year", a year-long series of lectures, exhibitions and events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, publications, fliers, brochures, plans, drawings, photographs and ephemeral materials pertaining to the operation of the Dodd Research Center and its programs. Over time additional files pertaining to the operation of Special Collections and Historical Manuscripts and Archives have been added, creating some overlap between Series II-V. All materials relate to the functioning of the Archives & Special Collections area as a unit of the University of Connecticut Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series VI: Media ( undated, ) includes Cornell West and other recorded lectures as well as photographs of A& SC events.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following materials have been separated from the collection and cataloged:
Connecticut History Online Reception Dodd Video 108
Connecticut Children's Book fair Lecture, November 9, 2001 Dodd Video 111
Teale Lecture Series by Joseph Bruchac Dodd Video 388
UConn Sackler Lecture on Human Rights with Harold Koh October 2, 2007 Dodd DVD 93
Readings from Sen. Chris Dodd's Book "Letters from Nuremburg" October 1, 2007 Dodd DVD 94
2004 Strochlitz Presentation Dr. Philip Nel, Writing Lives Ruth Krauss and Crockett Johnson [damaged, removed 2/8/2010]
Birthing a New Healthcare System, Nancy Johnson, March 24, 2008 Dodd Video 397
Edwin Way Teale Lecture Series, Gary Snyder 1998-0290.ac1
Teale Lecture Series 2006-2007, David Allen Sibley, April 12, 2007; 1998-0290.vr1
Death Penalty in CT "Hot Issues" Forum September 26, 2001; 1998-0290.vr5
Doris and Simon Konover Speaker, Rabbi Kesler, President Hartley 1998-0290.ac3
RBS Greenwich Capital Economic Seminar: Peter Fisher 1998-0290.dvd1

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], University of Connecticut, Thomas J. Dodd Research Center Records. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials in the collection have been periodically transferred by the area staff to the University Archives.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students, etc.]. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

A look back at a year of introspection / producer, Mark J. Roy. Dodd year retrospective. A montage of Dodd Center events concerning human rights from the 1995-1996 school year. Includes footage of Bill Clinton's speech at the dedication of the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, Simon Konover and others speaking at panel of Holocaust survivors, a panel on Executive Order 9066, the order that caused the internment of Japanese-Americans during the Second World War, a speech by Cornell West on race, Dith Pran talking on the Cambodian killing fields, and Madeline Albright on Rwanda,

Dodd Prize 2003. Thomas J. Dodd Prize. Speakers, Ambassador Thomas J. Dodd, Jr., Senator Christopher Dodd, Prime Minister Bertie Ahern, Deputy Prime Minister John Prescott (accepting for Prime Minister Blair). Ceremony for the awarding of the first Thomas J. Dodd Prize in International Justice and Human Rights to Prime Minister Bertie Ahern and Prime Minister Tony Blair for their work on the Good Friday Peace Accords,
Thomas Dodd and Legacy of Nuremburg,
